condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Systems for monitoring, reporting and responding to violations of children’s rights are strengthened.

description.narrative: The Iraq Country Task Force (CTF) on Monitoring and Reporting Mechanism (MRM) on grave child rights violations increased its capacity on monitoring and reporting and its verification rate, for timely and accurate reporting to inform programming and advocacy on grave child rights violations. Children who were associated with armed actors and those at risk were provided with reintegration services to support their reintegration back to their communities, while families and children have increased knowledge of risks from unexploded ordnance (UXO), explosive remnants of war (ERW) and improvised explosive devices (IED) through education and awareness | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/12/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of reported incidents of grave violations that are verified.
Existence of a National Strategy for the release and community-based reintegration of children from armed forces and groups
Existence of a fully functional UNICEF-supported mechanism to monitor and report on grave violations against children (MRM)
Functional inter-ministerial committee for dialogue with UN and to prevent and respond to grave violations.
